alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Hunterdon; Mercer; Middlesex; Morris; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Somerset; Southeastern Burlington; Sussex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Atlantic, Ocean, east central Hunterdon, Morris, Sussex, Mercer, northeastern Cape May, Burlington, Somerset, Monmouth and Middlesex Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from High Point to Beesleys Point. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Trenton, New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Atlantic City, Long Branch, Morristown, Asbury Park, Somerville, Ocean City, Newton, Sandy Hook, Somerset, Edison, Lakewood, Middletown, Old Bridge, Jackson, Howell and East Brunswick. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 13. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 26 and 40. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 24 and 47. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 34. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 54 and 70. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 52. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 19 and 134. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 0 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
